reviews.review: This game is really incredible. I played the first one on xbox and although this one is very different because of advancement of graphics as well a different angle the game took. As oppossed to the original this game is very bright and doesnt try to be scary at all. Also the story of this game is mind blowing and paired with a very fun gameplay (The use of Salts is awesome) makes this game a really great buy. If its on sale I recommend jumping on it.
One of the worst endings to a video game I've seen in a long time, I don't understand how everyone views this game as anything other than abyssmal
this game is amazing! great graphics and really cool gameplay and a pretty interesting story as well

I can't even joke about this game.

There are very few games I would praise as being masterpieces, since I'm not easy with praise. This game is what I consider one of the best games of our time. Flawlessly presently, masterfully written, a great experience throughout. This is the game that other games want to be. The story, be it not flawless, is engauging and intense. The one thing I have to give boundless praise is that though the game plays very cinematically (having "movie" moments that define the stages of the plot) It does not take away from the gameplay experience like most video games that try to be movies tend to do. No, this does it like no other. The gameplay is so fluid, engauging and filled to the brim with sheer brilliance that you don't even mind that you're playing through a linear story progression. You just live it.
The characters are one thing. Elizabeth is the shining star in this game. She just acts so much like a human being, and the other thing I love is that she's anything but cliche. Most female characters go these two ways; one, they become helpless and always need to be saved, and two, they try to be "badass" and just become a female version of male brutes in the vague act of trying to seem independent and counter the damsel sterotype. Elizabeth is a human being. She feels, talks and acts like a human being. I couldn't ask for a better character.
All in all, This game is near flawless. Besides some nitpicks, this game was insanely fun and satisfying. A engauging story, flawless gameplay, perfected presentation. Buy this game, you will not be dissapointed.
9.9/10

Excellent jeu, très bonne suite à la série malgré que l'on fasse le tour très (trop) rapidement (20h) en prenant son temps qui plus est ! De plus, le système d'armes choisit est décevant, ne pas pouvoir avoir toutes les armes que l'on veut à la fois et devoir passer son temps à courir après les NPCs qui ont celle dont on a besoin est vite frustrant, heureusement que les failles aident beaucoup a compenser cet aspect.

Je crois qu'à trop vouloir rejoindre un vaste publique et sortir un jeu rapidement on a laissé tomber la communauté et perdu de bien belle parties du jeu (le hackage des machines entre autre !) manquent vraiment à l'ambiance et l'immersion que BioShock nous avait habitué, espérons juste que la suite (s'il y a), sera meilleur et surtout plus longue; franchement 20h c'est bien peu pour un jeu dece style !

Au final, c'est un bon achat quand le jeu est en spécial, comme maintenant ;)

One hell of a game! It's one of those rare games that hooks you from the very beginning, and goes all the way in creating an immersive setting and narrative. Needless to say that these are the central elements of this game. The flying city of Columbia is visually stunning, and the storyline is intense and intriguing. Prepare to have your jaw dropped every once in a while, due to an ingenius plot twist (and prepare to be mind-blown in the end!). As in every Bioshock, Infinite will provide you with brainfood in terms of an in-dept analysis of political ideals and the place of science in society. However, the storyline is more focused on the protagonists, compared to the previous games. Speaking of which, the main characters are wonderfully 'real', and you will develop a sense of care for them.  
Surprisingly, I found the combat less interesting. Yes, it's fast-paced. Yes, it has all the features that made old-school shooters great. But I can't help but considering the battles an unnecessary obligation. But don't be disappointed; you'll have a lot of heartpounding shoot-outs, worthy of rememberance. It's just that looking around looking for bits and pieces of the multi-layered story is what makes this game really great.

In short: a masterpiece, in every sense of the word. This is hardly a game, it's pure art.

The Bioshock series has long been of my all time favorite series, and Infinite does not disappoint.

A different kind of character study--one attached to, simply put, the most satisfying FPS experience I have ever had. Infinite isn't just a sequel to undoubtedly one of the best games ever made, it's a work of art. An epic story, dynamic characters (especially Elizabeth, a sympathetic and very humanlike NPC on par with Alyx of the HL saga), an extremely rich and detailed world are all fused onto thrilling, multi-leveled combat made extremely customizable by the vast array of weapons and Vigors (Plasmids) that allow the player to play the game as they want to. Amidst a sea of bland military shooters and everyone else just playing copycat to rake in a little more money, Bioshock Infinite rises well above them all; a game that will be remembered long after Call of Duty fades from popularity.
badass
Great new addition to the series. It preserved the positive elements of the Bioshock combat feel while improving the realism (limiting the weapons' carried to two). A lot of fun.

Als Shooter ist Bioshock Infinite eigentlich zu einfach. Macht aber nichts, denn Handlung und Atmosphäre sind so mitreißend, dass man sich gar nicht lange mit Kämpfen befassen will. Stellenweise gibt es Momente, wo man einfach nur die lebendige Umgebung erkundet, ohne wirklich etwas zu unternehmen. Wenn man nicht durchrennt, sondern auch noch ein bisschen was erkundet zwecks Verbesserungen und Ausrüstung, hat man 14 spannungsgeladene Stunden hinter sich ... Die vielen Tonaufzeichnungen und Filmchen im Spiel sollte man nicht verpassen. Die füttern die Geschichte ordentlich auf.

シナリオ、ゲーム性と合わせても96点はいきすぎと見ます。　
主人公（ブッカー）は借金返済のために囚われの少女エリザベスを連れてくる依頼を受けるお話。
シングルプレイのみ。シナリオは一貫しているので新たに見られる新展開はないです。エンディングは1つです。DLCに続編のようなものはありますが、厳密には繋がっていないと思います。
このゲームの上での最大の見所は主人公の超能力と支援のエリザベスによる連携の戦闘なのですが、超能力は使用に限度があるし、ほとんどは銃撃によるトドメになるため使い時が悩みどころ、回復アイテムも限界があるために戦略が求められます。かといってEasyやNomalだと緊張感がなくHard以上になるとエリザベスの支援もあまり意味がないため何だかその辺りはイマイチでした。
それでもやり込むため（？）のこだわりは随所にあって、クリア後から色々集めるうちにこういうことだったのかと思うこともしばしば。
私的な感想だと1,000円くらいで買って損はなかったかなという程度。
Bioshock2がアフターストーリーでもなんでもないスピンオフなのでご注意を。有料のDLCについてはベリアル･アット･シー EPISODE 1とEPISODE2が続編にあたるようですが本筋のストーリーそのものはこの一本で終わっているので私には蛇足に思います。クリアしてから調べることをお勧めします。
総評としてはストーリーだけ楽しむゲーム。超能力とかがお好きな人にはお勧めします。
Great game. Amazing history

Loved this so much. First game I've played all the way through in a long time. Everything is so beautiful, played on easy so I could spend some time wandering around and looking at all the details. The ending was pretty good, but I feel like it could have been built up a little more effectively; the build-up to the ending lasted about 10 minutes, but I feel they could have made more out of it, story-wise.
Either way, all in all a fantastic gaming experience, even for a n00b like me, and actually ran really well on my Macbook.

This is great.  Action packed fun with an invincible follower while riding rails through the skies, an unforgettable story and setting and amazing visuals everwhere you turn.

Only con I can think of is if you are a fan of the other Bioshock games.  This plays differently as it is more action based rather than horror.

Oh my god, what the hell is this game? What the hell *isn't* this game? Words really don't do it justice.

This game elevates interactive storytelling in so many ways. The gameplay is fantastic, the graphics are stunning, everything is just great. But what really shines is how it tells an incredibly complex and detailed plotline, one that spans entire universes and questions the nature of time and reality.

Other good things:
a. Some of the best support for my Xbox 360 USB controller I've seen in a Mac game.
b. Did I mention "Mac game"? Yeah, it's that, and a super high-quality port at that.

Quibbles:
a. Having not played a previous Bioshock game, I wasn't super sure how to approach it, and I probably played through way too quickly my first time around. There is a LOT of detail to take in, and a lot of that is lost if you play it like Quake3.
b. The first episode of the "Burial At Sea" DLC was frustratingly short. Such a beautiful world, so expansive and rich... But it feels like you only get to visit two small parts of it (That said, I still found it worthwhile).

so much fun,

Infinite is flat out an incredible experience. Story comes first and foremost and the overall polish shines through. The setting and characters are so well thought out and memorable it's no wonder Infinite has been four years in the making.

It's a first person shooter for people who favor story and immersion over expanse and exploration. Don't get me wrong, there is plenty to explore in Infinite but this game is far more similar to Half-Life 2 than FarCry 3. But if you liked the original Bioshock, you won't be disappointed here. In fact, you might find this game to be superior in overall story as drift further into the game and build a relationship with Elizabeth. There is so much packed into this game it warrants a second play through, for sure.

Elizabeth isn't your regular damsel in distress. She may be a virgin lamb, so to speak, but she learns over time that she is much, much more. Entangled in this grandiose dystopian story as much as the city itself, Elizabeth is a shining example of fantastic storytelling and craftsmanship. She has a life and you feel her emotions and her struggles. You see her change over time due to the cruelty of Columbia. Truly fantastic.

The possibilities in combat are nearly limitless. With well over a dozen weapons, variants, and upgrades to them (plus your Vigors) the combat is really about how you want it. Some people complain about the rail system being just a loop around the battlefield, but it's still pretty dang cool if you ask me. Adding another level of combat, movement, and exploration. Other games lack these innovations, but Infinite does not.

The themes of religion, race supremacy, lust, greed, are in full effect here and honestly, that's what made the original Bioshock so appealing. Others have said the violence is over the top at times, with the Sky-Hook kills, and I too found it shocking at first. But over time the violence felt right at home with all the jingoist and xenophobic policies flying around. Whether it's a city in the sky or at the bottom of an ocean, human relations remain the same. Even in paradise, we're all still flawed.

Besides this being the best god damn game ever, the graphics being stunning, the story being utterly epic, the ending being thought-provoking and it being a huge next step for all videogames, I could put all of that aside and you should still buy the game simply because Elizabeth is also hot. Skip out on lunch for a week if you need to but you need to buy this game.

One of the best games of 2013, hands down. With the addicting fight mechanics and complex and incredibly well-done storyline, this game is a must for anyone, even if you haven't played the other games. I cannot speak to the dlc yet, as I do not have the cash to get it, but as for the core game, it was bloody amazing and ridiculously fun to go through.
The combat is super easy to get the hang of (at least for me, and I had difficulty with the original fighting mechanics). I found myself leaping off and on the rails to dodge enemy attacks and shoot their backs while crying "Haha, suckers! Take that!" (until, of course, they leapt on the rails after me.) With health and ammo flying your way as well, it makes combat a bit easier, while still providing quite a challenge. There were times where I was near death and kept waiting for some health, only to realize that she couldn't find any. With the enemies closing in, I did the only thing I could do. Make a tactical retreat. (THEN she threw health at me.)
That aside, if you love storylines, you'll love this one. I wasn't expecting it. I had an idea about some parts of the story and managed to be right, while the larger plot points threw me for a loop. It was brilliant. I can't say much more than that.
So would I recommend this game? Yes. Without a doubt. I would recommend it to anyone, even if said person doesn't like video games. "Just look at this one," I'd say, gleefully, hope in my eyes, "because this one isn't like other games. It's one of the best out there."
Go get this game, then. What are you still here for? Scrounge up some cash, because you can't miss this.

Entschuldigt mir bitte den ein oder anderen Rechtschreibfehler oder was auch immer, schreibe nur mit Tränen in den Augen.
Es hat... einfach mein Gamer-Herz berürht.

Bioshock Infinite - лучшая игра в 2013 году! Вы наверное спросите почему?

1. Качественно проработанный мир, который буквально живёт своей жизнью. 
2. Очень красивая графика, левел дизайн постоянно менялся и не заставлял нас скучать.
3. Сюжет великолепный! Если вы не внимательно следили за событиями в игре по мере прохождения, вы ничего в конце не поймёте.
4. Интересные перестрелки, которые совсем чуть-чуть надоедают в конце игры.

Итог - 10/10. Игра, которая надолго останеться в моей памяти.

Take my advice: "Buy this game or you'll be in debt to yourself... that's the deal."
